paper_abstract: An asymptotic lower bound for the maxrun function rho(n) = max {number of runs in string x I all strings x of length n} is presented. More precisely, it is shown that for any epsilon > 0, (alpha-epsilon)n is an asymptotic lower bound, where alpha = 3/1 + root 5 approximate to 0.927. A recent construction of an increasing sequence of binary strings "rich in runs" is modified and extended to prove the result.
paper_title: An asymptotic lower bound for the maximal number of runs in a string
